title: Integrate agent activity into Mission Control dashboard
description:
Problem: When agents (Tank, Shuri, Keymaker) work on tasks via sessions_spawn, their activity is invisible in Mission Control. The Architect needs real-time visibility of what each agent is doing.

Requirements:
1. Auto-create tasks in Mission Control when Oracle delegates via sessions_spawn
2. Stream agent progress/logs to Mission Control (use activity logs or messages/)
3. Show agent status: idle/working/blocked
4. Display task completion announcements in the dashboard
5. Track Oracle's delegation actions as tasks

Technical approach: Hook into OpenClaw agent sessions, parse session logs/transcripts, and feed updates to Mission Control's activity log and WebSocket broadcasts.

This is critical for operational visibility.

comments.author: agent-tank
comments.content:
Implementation complete! Created agent-bridge.js that:

1. ✅ Auto-creates tasks when sessions spawn
2. ✅ Streams agent activity to logs
3. ✅ Updates agent status (idle/busy)
4. ✅ Moves tasks to REVIEW on completion
5. ✅ WebSocket broadcast for real-time updates

Files created:
- server/agent-bridge.js - Main bridge service
- server/start-all.js - Unified startup
- docs/AGENT-BRIDGE.md - Documentation

To run: `npm run all` in server/ directory
